title: Fairly heavy rainfall likely in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and North-western provinces and in Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (11).

title: Person injured in police fire in Kiribathgoda
byline: A person has been injured and hospitalized in police fire at the Gala Junction in Kiribathgoda, early this morning (11).

title: 3 adults, 3 children dead after passenger helicopter crashes in the Hudson River
byline: A family’s afternoon sightseeing excursion above the misty shoreline of Manhattan ended in tragedy Thursday after the helicopter carrying them crashed off the New Jersey shoreline, killing them and the pilot.

title: Sri Lanka sells Rs. 100 billion in 2029 & 2034 T-bonds
byline: Sri Lanka has sold Rs. 100 billion in 2029 and 2034 bonds during yesterday’s auction as the secondary market saw a decisive shift from the sustained selling sentiment, a trend largely owing to US President Donald Trump’s tariff measures.

title: Second phase of first school term ends
byline: The second phase of the first school term concludes today (April 11), marking the start of a one-week holiday in celebration of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: Limited passport services on April 15–17
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced that its 24-hour one-day passport issuance service will be temporarily suspended on April 15, 16, and 17, in view of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year holidays.

title: Myanmar Earthquake: Sri Lanka grants USD 1 million in financial assistance
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has extended financial assistance amounting to USD 1 million to provide relief to the people of Myanmar affected by the recent earthquake.

title: Police officer hailed hero after saving drowning girl in Mahaweli River
byline: A police officer deployed on traffic duties in Katugastota, Kandy has been hailed a hero after he rescued a girl from drowning in the Mahaweli River.

title: Underwater Avurudu festival for the first time in Sri Lanka
byline: For the first-time ever, a unique underwater Sinhala and Tamil New Year festival has been held in seas off Trincomalee.

title: 9,000 children identified as autistic in Sri Lanka
byline: According to latest data, over 9,000 children have been identified as autistic in Sri Lanka.

title: Keheliya arrives at CID again
byline: Former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record a statement.

title: Number of LG-election related complaints surpasses 1,000
byline: The number of complaints filed with the National Election Commission in relation to the upcoming Local Government (LG) Election has surpassed 1,000.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on VAT (Amendment) Bill
byline: The Speaker of Parliament (Dr.) Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill in Parliament.

title: April ‘Aswesuma’ welfare allowance disbursed
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board has announced that the welfare allowance for the month of April, under the ‘Aswesuma’ program, will be available to beneficiaries starting today (Apr 11).

title: Apple airlifts 600 tons of iPhones from India ‘to beat’ Trump tariffs
byline: Tech giant Apple chartered cargo flights to ferry 600 tons of iPhones, or as many as 1.5 million, to the United States from India, after it stepped up production there in an effort to beat President Donald Trump’s tariffs, sources told Reuters.

title: Gold bolts past $3,200 on dollar slide, safe-haven flows
byline: Gold prices breached the key $3,200/oz level for the first time on Friday, fuelled by a weaker dollar and an escalating trade war that sent investors rushing toward safe-haven assets.

title: ‘Squid Game’ actor O Yeong Su sentenced to one-year imprisonment in sexual assault case
byline: South Korean actor O Yeong Su, who rose to global prominence as Player 001 in Netflix’s Squid Game, has been sentenced to one year in prison after being found guilty of sexual assault, according to South Korean media reports.

title: Several new projects under “Clean Sri Lanka” Programme to begin in April
byline: A total of 34 new projects under the “Clean Sri Lanka” programme are scheduled to be implemented this year. Work on many of these projects is scheduled to commence by the end of this April, the President’s Media Division said in a statement.

title: More time needed to gauge impact of global shocks on Sri Lanka’s economy: IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says that the Sri Lankan government remains committed to program objectives and implementation is strong and commendable, but more time is needed to assess the implications for Sri Lanka of the external shock as global uncertainty remains elevated and is contributing to financial market volatility.

title: More time needed to gauge impact of global shocks on Sri Lanka’s economy: IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says that the Sri Lankan government remains committed to program objectives and implementation is strong and commendable, but more time is needed to assess the implications for Sri Lanka of the external shock as global uncertainty remains elevated and is contributing to financial market volatility.

title: Court lifts stay order issued on elections for several LG bodies including CMC
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered to lift the injunction order issued previously preventing the conduct of the Local Government Election for 18 local government bodies including the Colombo Municipal Council on 6 May.

title: Gold prices surge in Sri Lanka as rates hit record levels globally
byline: The price of a pound of 22-carat gold in Sri Lanka has risen to Rs. 235,500 today, according to traders, after the prices surged past the significant USD 3,200 per ounce mark for the first time in the world market.

title: CEB signs power purchase agreement for 350 MW Sahasdhanavi Power Plant
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has signed the Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) for the 350 MW Sahasdhanavi Combined Cycle Power Plant, which will be built, owned, and operated by Sahasdhanavi Limited. M

title: China hits back at Trump tariff hike, raises duties on US goods to 125%
byline: Beijing on Friday increased its tariffs on U.S. imports to 125%, hitting back against U.S. President Donald Trump’s decision to hike duties on Chinese goods to 145%, raising the stakes in a trade war that threatens to up-end global supply chains.

title: Avurudu ‘Kevili’ table costs 7% more in 2025, research suggests
byline: The cost of preparing a traditional kevili table for the Sinhala and Tamil New Year has risen by 7 percent in 2025 compared to the previous year, Verité Research says.

title: Bribery Commission summons ex-President Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been requested to be present before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in relation to a statement he had made about the bribery case filed against New Democratic Front MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake.

title: Expressway tolls can be paid using debit, credit cards from May 1
byline: The general public will be able to use their debit and credit cards to pay for expressway tolls from May 1, 2025, according to Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayaka.

title: Ex-President Ranil says prepared to appear before Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has indicated that he is prepared to appear before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to record a statement about the bribery case filed against New Democratic Front MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake.

title: Oscars to add stunt design award for its 100th ceremony
byline: After many years of impassioned calls for an Oscar recognizing the art of the stunt, the film academy has decided to give it an official award.

title: Police officers can now issue multiple charge sheets for traffic violators
byline: Police will be able to issue more than one charge sheet for traffic violators with the introduction of the online instant payment method to pay fines through the ‘GovPay’ application, Harsha Purasinghe, a board member of the Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) said.

title: SLBFE warns of fake video on YouTube targeting expat workers
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has refuted a claim circulated through a YouTube channel operating from a foreign country, that migrant workers will be given Rs. 10,000 each for the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: Sri Lankan man found electrocuted during floods in Malaysia
byline: A Sri Lankan man and a dog were found dead, believed to have been electrocuted, during a flood at a construction material storage facility in Taman Alam Indah, Shah Alam in Malaysia.

title: Pope Francis makes surprise visit to St. Peter’s in non-religious clothes
byline: Pope Francis, who is taking two months’ rest as he recovers from double pneumonia, made an unannounced visit to St. Peter’s Basilica in the Vatican on Thursday dressed in black pants rather than his usual, traditional white papal attire.

title: Sri Lankan tri-service relief team continues humanitarian efforts in Myanmar
byline: A specially deployed Sri Lankan Humanitarian Assistance and Relief Team, consisting of personnel from the Army, Navy and Air Force, continues to support on-going disaster recovery operations in Myanmar following the recent powerful earthquake that caused significant damage and displacement.
